page.title: 01Maxton & the River Tweed
page.content: The area is bisected by the meandering River Tweed. Within the aera there is only one link for road traffic.(plus a further little used pedestrian bridge). The main community is Maxton on the South of the River, with a population of about 100. There is small hamlet at Churtmain and a number of scotish houses and farms. The area is sparsley settld but 2 main roads run E - W across the area. The majority of the population work in neaby town 5 - 10 miles away. The area is scenically very attractive, with pleasant views of the tripel peaked Elba Hills 3 miles away often with the river in the foreground
